result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Billy J. St. Clair

records.addlTxt: Email sent to Douglas Co jail advising def has court on Dec 5;  ka

10:09 AM Defendant Billy J. St. Clair appeared by video, in custody from Douglas County.  Attorney Kenneth W. Ryder III appeared by video for Billy J. St. Clair.  Attorney David V. Meany appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Cases 22CF157 and 22CM57.  Atty, recv'd complaints, waives reading, waives right to prelim hearing in 22CF157.  Def agrees, to waive right to prelim hearing.  Atty is satisfied.  Court accepts waiver.  Court has reviewed compliant finds PC that def has committed a felony, case is bound over for arraignment.  State just filed information that mirrors charges in complaint.  Atty, proceed now, NG to all counts in both cases, noted.
Status conference scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Status conference on December 5, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Email sent to Douglas Co jail advising def has court on Oct 10 at 10:00;  ka

2:07 PM Defendant Billy J. St. Clair appeared by video, in custody from Douglas County.  Attorney David V. Meany appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Cases 22CF157 and 22CM57.  Atty Ryder for 22CM57, no Atty in other case.  Atty, made special appearance, Atty is appointed in 22CF157.  Atty is not able to complete initial appearance in 22CF157.  Atty believes he has pending charges in Douglas County.  Def states that he is a PO hold.  22CF157 AIA and STC in 22CM57.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Def shall not possess or consume any mind-altering substances meaning alcoholic beverages, controlled substances, inhalants, synthetic marijuana, or similar substances and/or over the counter medications used contrary to label instructions, or prescription medications not taken in compliance with a prescription issued to the defendant.  Def is not to go into any place where mind altering substances are present, maintained, sold or consumed, except defendant may enter a convenience store or grocery store, even if alcohol is sold there.
